answer: Broadjam does not allow its servers to be used for the transmission of spam. Customers suspected of using Broadjam products and services for sending spam will be fully investigated, and appropriate actions will be taken to resolve the situation. Additionally, Hosting Subscribers must abide by all applicable laws and regulations, including the Can-Spam Act of 2003 and the Telephone Consumer Protection Act, as well as Broadjam's no-spam policies. Commercial advertising and bulk emails or faxes can only be sent to recipients who have opted in to receive messages from the sender, and specific information must be included in the email or fax footer.
